# Analysis

-   Estimates for the past ten years broken out by Age, Sex, Race
-   Employment Status & Work Experience

<br> <br>

# What We Found

-   U.S. Census data from the past decade highlights a strong link between education and poverty
-   with college graduates facing a significantly lower poverty rate of around 4% compared to nearly 24% for those without a high school diploma
-   Gender disparities are evident, with males generally experiencing lower poverty rates than females
-   Racially, African Americans, Hispanics, and Native Americans have seen a decline in poverty rates mirrored by a decrease in childhood poverty from 22% to 16%
